page.title: 01Upland Farms, Dumfriesshire
page.content: The area is upland farming country reached by taking one of 2 farm roads off the B7068. It includes 2 farms, Clenchfoot & Westwater, their relevant buildings & workers cottages. They specialise in animals, cattle & sheep, with just a few fields of winter fodder. The land is partly enclosed by dry-stone walls & the higher areas are left unfenced. There are many natural boundaries formed by ridges & gullies with burns in them. There are very few dwellings in the area and no amenities There are clumps of forestation on the higher land which are not commercial in origin & probably acting as shelter but there are also large areas of commercial forestation, all of a coniferous nature. The 2 main waterways are Glentenment burn & Logan Water, the latter is being rerouted during the building of the new road.
